basis: The user explicitly endorses an ultra-low-pressure approach and indicates a tiny sip now is doable, signaling alignment with the suggestion and intent to act.
cognitive_dissonance: Internal conflict between wanting to follow a gentle plan and heightened anxiety/irregular eating patterns, creating ambivalence about taking action and dependence on moment-to-moment readiness.
negative_thought_patterns: All-or-nothing thinking about eating; catastrophizing anxiety; self-criticism for not committing to snacks or reminders; fear of losing control if pressured.
emotional_triggers: Acute anxiety, irregular eating schedule, fear of making the wrong choice, worry about reminders, concern about being judged for pace.
coaching_notes: Keep validating ultra-low-pressure choices, acknowledge progress regardless of action size, offer optional micro-actions only when the user signals readiness, use grounding techniques if anxiety intensifies, and check in on readiness before adding any reminders or snacks.
